intro: Chaetogastra longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved chaetogastra, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and lance-shaped leaves with a glossy surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have five petals. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments.
